properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 11:21AM CST until February 5 at 6:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo TX
properties.description:
...Heavy Snow Possible in the Big Country tonight into
Wednesday...with an area of sleet and snow possible farther south
across the Concho Valley, Heartland and Northern Edwards
Plateau...

The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a Winter
Weather Advisory for sleet, freezing rain and snow which is in
effect from 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Wednesday.

* WHAT...An accumulation of sleet topped by 1 to 3 inches of snow
expected.

* WHERE...Northern Edwards Plateau including Crockett and
Schleicher counties.

* WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday afternoon.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Hazardous travel conditions will develop
late Tuesday night and will continue into Wednesday.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for
slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while
driving.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY
